name: Looking for advice on refining a lvl 20 build
author: Cenerae

posts.author: Cenerae
posts.content:
I wanted to have a try at making a dual wielding kama weaponmaster on the server I play on, so I iterated on this a few times. Just to get some things out of the way to account for server specific things:

- The race chosen is Tiefling (+2 dex, +2 int, -2 cha). The server allows for genasi of all stripes, as well as aasimar and mephlings. Githzerai and Githyanki too, though I decided I wanted to stay at ECL +1 at the most. But for those familiar with the alternatives, and that includes quasi and para genasi, they're on the table.

- The server grants Ambidexterity for free after taking Two Weapon Fighting. That's pretty much the only reason I felt comfortable building this on a tiefling, since I give up the additional feat a Human would get.

- This could probably be done on a human, but it would require some stat finangling. My initial version of this was 10 ranger/3 monk/7 weaponmaster as a human, so it would work, but I don't think it would be as strong.

- I don't have this set out all pretty like everyone else does. Sorry!

posts.author: hunearo
posts.content:
Hi!
After a quick glance on the build:
I would go monk 6 / fighter 6 / wm 8, this way the toon gains +1 bab, +1 on reflex saves and 2 hp. The loss of 2 skill points and and the wholeness of body feat is not a big price.
You can't take spring attack at lvl3 because of the +4 bab prereq, you should switch it with expertise.
I think you miscalculated the skills somewhere a bit, my cbc sheet says you have 45 points left (43 with my class distribution). I would take full discipline, and a detection skill with the rest. Listen is a class skill for both wm and monk, but the spot is only for wm, so it has less dump levels. Also I would consider drop heal completely, and take some crossclass trapping, so you get an alternative way of killing enemies.

posts.author: Cenerae
posts.content:
Changing the level to WM doesn't gain me any BAB, so it would only be the +1 reflex save (and 1 more use of Ki Strike). Which is still more valuable than Wholeness of Body, so I'll make that switch.

Noted, on the feat ordering.

I rough mathed the skill points by hand so there's probably some mistakes there. Taking a detection skill makes sense, though I'm not sure cross classing set trap is going to amount to much. Wouldn't be able to set anything better than deadly traps, and most every boss I would ever try to use them against on that server have and saves high enough to generally ignore them. Evasion isn't that rare either.

Either way, updated the initial post with the small changes and tried to math out the skill points again, which should now be correct.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
Is the base race for this a half elf or does the server use haks to make Tiefling a separate race at character creation? If it doesn't use haks then you will be missing 4 skill points since your INT doesn't increase to 14 until after character creation, which might account for the skill point discrepancy.
Also. does the Ambidexterity granted by the server count as a prerequisite for ITWF? Sometimes bonus feats do not count as prerequisites for classes or feats and need to be taken anyway, although with haks this might not be a problem.

Onto the build, you should lower the starting STR to 15 and increase either CON or INT by 2.
The feats look good, although personally I would move the dual-wielding feats to levels 15 and 18 in order to get Blind Fight and IC earlier. If concealment and invisibility is uncommon on your server then leaving Blind Fight at 18 probably won't be an issue.

posts.author: Cenerae
posts.content:
It's available at character creation. The Ambidexterity does qualify, as far as I'm aware. If not, that's going to be disappointing (and I think someone would have noted it by now...but I won't know for sure until I get there)

Blind Fight is available on helmets, and while not the helmets I would prefer to use in the long run, I can have it provided during the levelling process, so I'm fine with backending it.

Strength starts at 16 because there's the vague potential of taking the character to epics (the server allows levelling to 30, though most PCs end up getting stopped at 20 and staying there for their entire career). I guess it would make sense to drop 1 point in this case, still.

posts.author: Yunim
posts.content:
In that case you should have 110 total skill points, so with your current skills that gives you 20 spare skill points. I'd recommend 1 point in all skills that require training and then go with hunearo's suggestion of maxing Discipline by lowering Heal, unless Discipline isn't worth investing in.
A minor correction, your BAB is 18 not 17.
